Contents.Name: Block and Tackle
Contents.Description: A set of pulleys with a cable threaded through them and a hook to attach to objects. Allows you to hoist up to four times the weight you can normally lift.

Contents.Name: Book
Contents.Description: A book might contain poetry, historical accounts, information pertaining to a particular field of lore, diagrams and notes on gnomish contraptions, or just about anything else that can be represented using text or pictures. A book of spells is a spellbook.

Contents.Name: Candle
Contents.Description: For 1 hour, a candle sheds bright light in a 5-foot radius and dim light for another 5 feet.

Contents.Name: Chain (10 ft)
Contents.Description: A chain has 10 hit points. It can be burst with a successful DC 20 Strength check.

Contents.Name: Component Pouch
Contents.Description: A component pouch is a small, watertight leather belt pouch that has compartments to hold all the material components and other special items you need to cast your spells, except for those components that have a specific cost (as indicated in a spell's description).

Contents.Name: Fishing Tackle
Contents.Description: This kit includes a wooden rod, silken line, corkwood bobbers, steel hooks, lead sinkers, velvet lures, and narrow netting.

Contents.Name: Lock
Contents.Description: A key is provided with the lock. Without the key, a creature proficient with thieves' tools can pick this lock with a successful DC 15 Dexterity check.

Contents.Name: Magnifying Glass
Contents.Description: This lens allows a closer look at small objects. It is also useful as a substitute for flint and steel when starting fires. Lighting a fire with a magnifying glass requires light as bright as sunlight to focus, tinder to ignite, and about 5 minutes for the fire to ignite. A magnifying glass grants advantage on any ability check made to appraise or inspect an item that is small or highly detailed.

Contents.Name: Mess Kit
Contents.Description: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

Contents.Name: Rations (1 day)
Contents.Description: Rations consist of dry foods suitable for extended travel, including jerky, dried fruit, hardtack, and nuts.

Contents.Name: Rope - Hemp (50 ft)
Contents.Description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Contents.Name: Rope - Silk (50 ft)
Contents.Description: Rope, whether made of hemp or silk, has 2 hit points and can be burst with a DC 17 Strength check.

Contents.Name: Spellbook
Contents.Description: Essential for wizards, a spellbook is a leather-bound tome with 100 blank vellum pages suitable for recording spells.

Contents.Name: Spyglass
Contents.Description: Objects viewed through a spyglass are magnified to twice their size.
